Package model

Class Book

java.lang.Object
model.BibliographicProduct
model.Book
public class Book extends BibliographicProduct
The Book class represents a book in the virtual library system. It is a specific type of bibliographic product.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Book(String id, String name, int numberOfPages, Calendar publicationDate, String url, int pagesRead, String shortReview, String genre, double saleValue, int copiesSold)
    Constructs a Book object with the specified identifier, name, number of pages, publication date, URL, pages read, short review, genre, sale value, and copies sold.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    displayInformation()
    Displays the information of the book, including its ID, name, number of pages, publication date, URL, pages read, short review, genre, sale value, and copies sold.

  • Constructor Details

    • Book

      public Book(String id, String name, int numberOfPages, Calendar publicationDate, String url, int pagesRead, String shortReview, String genre, double saleValue, int copiesSold)
      Constructs a Book object with the specified identifier, name, number of pages, publication date, URL, pages read, short review, genre, sale value, and copies sold.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the book
      name - the name of the book
      numberOfPages - the number of pages in the book
      publicationDate - the publication date of the book
      url - the URL of the book
      pagesRead - the number of pages read in the book
      shortReview - the short review of the book
      genre - the genre of the book
      saleValue - the sale value of the book
      copiesSold - the number of copies sold for the book

  • Method Details

    • purchaseBook

      public void purchaseBook(double amountPaid)
      Increments the count of sales for the book by one and generates a purchase receipt with the current date and the amount paid.
      Parameters:
      amountPaid - the amount paid for purchasing the book
